properties.areaDesc: Latimer, OK; Haskell, OK; Sebastian, AR; Pushmataha, OK; Crawford, AR; Washington, AR; Franklin, AR; Carroll, AR; Madison, AR; Sequoyah, OK; Le Flore, OK
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 12:25AM CST until January 11 at 6:15AM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Madison County in northwestern Arkansas...
Franklin County in west central Arkansas...
Crawford County in northwestern Arkansas...
Southeastern Carroll County in northwestern Arkansas...
Sebastian County in west central Arkansas...
Southeastern Washington County in northwestern Arkansas...
Southeastern Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Pushmataha County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Southeastern Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma...
Latimer County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Le Flore County in southeastern Oklahoma...

* Until 615 AM CST.

* At 1221 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated widespread light to
moderate rain ongoing across much of southeast Oklahoma through
western Arkansas. These rains will end by 4 AM with additional
rainfall amounts of one half inch or less. Heavy rains fell Friday
evening with flooded reported across the region. These flood
waters will be slow to recede resulting in flooded roadways
persisting through the overnight hours.

* Some locations that may experience flooding include...
Fort Smith...                     Van Buren...
Poteau...                         Ozark...
Charleston...                     Antlers...
Huntsville...                     Cedarville...
Clayton...                        Mountainburg...
Greenwood...                      Alma...
Barling...                        Pocola...
Muldrow...                        Heavener...
Roland...                         Green Forest...
Lavaca...                         Spiro...

Additional rainfall amounts of one half inch are possible in the
warned area through 4 AM.

This includes the following highways,
Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 42.
Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 317 and 328.
Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14.
Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 39.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.
